content.text:
# Golden Horse Award for Best Leading Actress

}}
The Golden Horse Award for Best Leading Actress () is presented annually at Taiwan's Golden Horse Film Awards.
Hong Kong actress Maggie Cheung holds the record for the most wins in this category, with four, for her performances in Full Moon in New York (1989), Center Stage (1991), Comrades: Almost a Love Story (1997), and In the Mood for Love (2001). Taiwanese actress Sylvia Chang holds the record for the most nominations, with eleven.
Winners and nominees
won four times for Full Moon in New York (1989), Center Stage (1991), Comrades: Almost a Love Story (1997), and In the Mood for Love (2001)]]
won thrice for My Grandfather (1981), Passion (1986), and A Light Never Goes Out (2022)]]
won twice for Red Rose White Rose (1994) and The Home Song Stories (2007)]]
won for Red Dust (1990)]]
won for Xiu Xiu: The Sent Down Girl (1998)]]
won for The Eye (2002)]]
won for Golden Chicken (2003)]]
won for Three Times (2005)]]
won for Perhaps Love (2006)]]
won for The Message (2009)]]
won for Girlfriend, Boyfriend (2012)]]
won for The Grandmaster (2013)]]
won for Zinnia Flower (2015)]]
won (ex-æquo) for Soul Mate (2016)]]
won (ex-æquo) for Soul Mate (2016)]]
won for The Bold, the Corrupt, and the Beautiful (2017)]]
won for Dear Ex (2018)]]
won for Little Big Women (2020)]]
won for The Falls (2021)]]
won for The Way We Talk (2024)]]
